snippet: The number of cases, attributing wrongful death or personal injury to an ignition defect, suggest more victims than the company has acknowledged.
abstract: Kenneth R Feinberg, lawyer hired by General Motors to explore compensating victims of cars with defective ignition switch, meets with representative of hundreds of people and their families who say they were affected by accidents involving company's vehicles.

byline.original: By HILARY STOUT and DANIELLE IVORY
byline.contributor: John Schwartz and Rebecca R. Ruiz contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The number of cases, attributing wrongful death or personal injury to an ignition defect, suggest more victims than the company has acknowledged.

headline.main: G.M. Talks to Families With Claims Over Defects
headline.print_headline: G.M. Talks to Families With Claims Over Defects
